      35             : /**
      36             :  * @brief RAII encapsulation of a prepared SQLite Statement.
      37             :  *
      38             :  * A Statement is a compiled SQL query ready to be executed step by step
      39             :  * to provide results one row at a time.
      40             :  *
      41             :  * Resource Acquisition Is Initialization (RAII) means that the Statement
      42             :  * is compiled in the constructor and finalized in the destructor, so that there is
      43             :  * no need to worry about memory management or the validity of the underlying SQLite Statement.
      44             :  *
      45             :  * Thread-safety: a Statement object shall not be shared by multiple threads, because :
      46             :  * 1) in the SQLite "Thread Safe" mode, "SQLite can be safely used by multiple threads
      47             :  *    provided that no single database connection is used simultaneously in two or more threads."
      48             :  * 2) the SQLite "Serialized" mode is not supported by SQLiteC++,
      49             :  *    because of the way it shares the underling SQLite precompiled statement
      50             :  *    in a custom shared pointer (See the inner class "Statement::Ptr").
      51             :  */

     441             :     /**
     442             :      * @brief Execute a step of the prepared query to fetch one row of results.
     443             :      *
     444             :      *  While true is returned, a row of results is available, and can be accessed
     445             :      * through the getColumn() method
     446             :      *
     447             :      * @see exec() execute a one-step prepared statement with no expected result
     448             :      * @see tryExecuteStep() try to execute a step of the prepared query to fetch one row of results, returning the sqlite result code.
     449             :      * @see Database::exec() is a shortcut to execute one or multiple statements without results
     450             :      *
